## Queue3.clean() method

Tells the queue remove all jobs created outside of a grace period in milliseconds. You can clean the jobs with the following states: completed, wait (typo for waiting), active, delayed, and failed.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
clean(grace: number, limit: number, type?: 'completed' | 'wait' | 'active' | 'paused' | 'delayed' | 'failed'): Promise<string[]>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  grace | number | Grace period in milliseconds. |
|  limit | number | Maximum amount of jobs to clean per call. If not provided will clean all matching jobs. |
|  type | 'completed' \| 'wait' \| 'active' \| 'paused' \| 'delayed' \| 'failed' | Status of the job to clean. Values are completed, wait, active, paused, delayed, and failed. Defaults to completed. |

<b>Returns:</b>

Promise&lt;string\[\]&gt;
